review: We booked a one night stay here as we had an early departure from Alicante Airport and chose the resort as we could stay together in an apartment. It's about 5 miles from the airport so really convenient. HOWEVER, it took us 2 hours driving round, and round, getting lost, asking again and again for directions before we found it! Sat Nav was of no help. It's not signposted so that didn't help. I can only suggest printing off a large scale detailed map to use. It is in the middle of nowhere, so no useful landmarks or road names to assist.  The resort itself is lovely with fantastic apartments, well equipped and very comfortable. There's a large swimming pool and lovely lush gardens. We had an evening meal in the restaurant which is up market but expensive and with very small…

title: Great golfing break
review: We have just returned from a lovely golfing holiday and stayed at this delightful, quiet resort. Being only 10 mins away from the airport you are on holiday almost immediately upon landing in Alicante. It is nowhere near the flight path and therefore extremely devoid of any airport activity. Our apartment was larger than expected and very clean however a kettle had to be requested but did arrive within a short while of our request. The staff were all very nice and helpful but I have to mention Maria who works in the restaurant overlooking the pool. She really went that extra mile for us and was always so gracious and utterly charming that we felt quite at home and at ease. She is a great asset to the resort.  The pools are a nice size and safe for non swimmers and children as…

title: Not for couples  - BAD LOCATION
review: We arrived in September 2016 to find this hotel is VERY far away from anything. Most of the reviews have stated to rent a car, which we are glad we did. There is nothing to walk to and everywhere around the hotel is prohibited (we assumed we could walk up the hills and mountains around). Taxi's are not cheap either.  The actual rooms are very nice, modern and clean and their are two pools and a restaurant. The pools aren't particularly clean (toilets/showers by the pools were extremely dirty) and a lot of the sundecks are broken (but when we went it was very empty so not too much of a problem). There was not much choice in food which is a little annoying when there are no bars/restaurants nearby.   Overall, if you are there to play golf then it is a good place to go- otherwise I…

title: Good hotel for family and friends holiday
review: Good and quite place.  Safe for family with kids near to Alicante airport. Good food and service . Room have a lot space , are clean . Had a lovely family holiday . Good service and nice atmosphere for single,groups and family

title: Another great Holiday
review: Just got back from our 2nd family holiday to El Plantio and it was as good as the first time, Lovely big clean apartments very relaxing and nice staff. Would recommend a visit to castle Santa Barbara. The food is great but could do with a bit more variety.  Would like to see some new sun beds on our next visit.

title: Relaxing,comfortable break away
review: Great holiday. lovely staff. great rooms.  Recommend putting mini bar price list in the fridge so people can be aware of the price of the items. Staff were very helpful when the fridge and freezer wasnt working. The cleaning staff were very polite and helpful.

title: Still no kettle!
review: Using this place as a stop off again before moving on.  Upon arrival the staff in reception were fantastic. We arrived very early and our room was not ready. We decided to drive into Alicante and they told us they would call our mobile when the room was ready. We requested an apartment with a roof terrace when we booked and where not disappointed! We are in a three bedroom apartment which is really big, stairs lead up to a roof terrace that gets the sun all day. There are lots of sun beds around the pool now which were not last year. Bar staff really friendly, prices of wine and beer really good. Bar menu food is good and prices are too. My only frustration getting to the apartment and having no kettle! Upon walking down to reception and asking for one, it arrived 10 minutes…

title: Great place to stay
review: This is a great place to stay as a family, all the staff are great, food for lunch was always superb and freshly prepared.  We had a car as the location is out of the way, which we have a preference for.  Alicante is around 7 or 8 kilometres away, there is a smaller Spanish village closer called Torrellano around 3 to 4 kilometres away.  Really big clean apartments, also a pretty good golf course with some tricky holes, thumbs up

title: Ok hotel
review: Second stay here for our holiday. Helpful and polite staff, nice price, two great pools, nice rooms with good a/c, washer&dryer included, golf course, really nice area with lots of greens, quiet area, nice beds.  What pulls score down,is the under par kitchen (please drop the fries, upgrade the menu), very remote location (rental car is a must!), horrible wifi connection,  gym room is located too far from the hotel, and is in terrible shape, few parking lots close to the apartments, tv channels are mainly spanish or dubbed.

title: One night stay
review: Modern resort and apartments comfortable.  Resort was lacking in character but the pool was beautiful with grass areas around it and play area for the children.  No local amenities within walking distance.

title: Good value hotel near the airport
review: Nice apartments situated round each of the two pools.  Baby pool included within each of the main pools.  One has a play park for kids.   Nice restaurant right next to the pool.  A 10 min drive to Alicante where there are lots of shops, restaurants, a marina, karaoke and several supermarkets to stock your apartment.  The gym is basically a weights room with a static bike so little aerobic work although of course you can walk or run round the golf course paths.  Sunbeds need some attention.  There are no sun umbrellas although you can purchase one quite reasonably from the larger supermarkets.

title: Last minute treat
review: After finding our flight plans needed rearrangement, we booked a hotel close to the airport and stumbled upon El Plantio. Very friendly staff, nice pool and spacious apartments overlooking either the pool or the golf course. Apartment had a full kitchen fridge, cooker pots and pans, spanish tv, wifi, washer dryer etc. One thing we notcied it's worth buying the water from the main bar and not from the mini bar ! We were able to relax by the pool and forget our travel woes, overall decent place

title: 3 night end of holiday stay
review: Quite unsure   Lovely great big apartment overlooking pool. Great breakfast.  As others have mentioned nowhere to dry your towels but they give you a washing machine and a tumble drier which must cost a fortune in electricity when they could give you a clothes horse to stick your stuff on ?? Seems daft anyway...  The staff work really hard and at times did feel as if they were understaffed. If they had a wee shop to buy essentials, they'd do well.  Lovely good choice of breakfast. Wasn't to keen on the food not much choice and way overpriced for drinks a gin €6.50 and the tonic €2, that's 5 star prices and no way is it that. Great big pool, but really manky didn't see anyone clean it and by the look of the bottom hadn't been done in a long time.  Won't return and wouldn't…

title: Loved it!
review: We were looking for a relaxing week for a family holiday - and we found it here! Just 10 min drive from Alicante Airport - but tucked away (no road or airport noise). When we arrived - we were shown the wrong apartment (2 bed rather than 3) but this was sorted out quickly.  The apartment we had was very spacious and comfortable. (I would say though that we were mostly self catering - and there were not enough pots, pans or utensils - so for a larger party it would have been very difficult to cater - however this is my one criticism).  We had lots of day trips planned - but didn't do any of them as the resort was so relaxing! The food in the restaurant was great. The golf was wonderful too. Wouldn't hesitate to go back.

title: Great place for a family
review: Stayed with 2 kids 12 and 9 years old, good place to relax and to soak up the sun! Little bit far out of the centre of Alicante, but nice to avoid the crowds. The restaurant was very busy on the night we arrived (Sunday) so the wait for food and drinks was Long. The facilities are great and I would recommend for anybody with a young family visiting Alicante who is not looking for the pace of the city.

title: Perfect for families
review: We are a couple with two kids, 2 and 4 years old. The location is remote an quite, but still close to Alicante city and the airport. There are two pools, both perfect for kids as they are divided with one part with a depth of 60 cm. one pool has a strip of approx 50 meters wich maked It perfect for a morning or evening swim. Restaurant is good, not to fancy but does the job well. Breakfast buffet is standard with all the necessities. I do not play golf but used the course for jogging with a nice scenery and plenty of Tarmac paths. The gym is very basic and not well maintained but still does the job. All in all a perfect place if you're traveling with young kids and is looking for an active holiday. Recomend renting a car if you want to get around as taxied in this area is hard…

title: A Bit Disgusting
review: The property has spacious rooms.  However they are clearly a bit tired.  More importantly, cleaning does not seem to be a top priority at this location.  We found a used baby bottle and all sorts of other trash in the pull out sofa.  When we mentioned this when checking out we received a perfunctory "sorry" without much feeling.

title: Excellent
review: Absolutely top class apartment. Wonderful kitchen facilities,spacious and two great pools for both adults and kids. Food is possibly above average with good service. Golf course is top quality and challenging.The only down point of the holiday was the lady in the golf course was a little rude and unhelpful. I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone interested in travelling to Alicante..

title: Terrific
review: Booked on line (Travel Republic, via Trivago) based on location and price. Would very happily come back any time. Great facilities, decent WiFi and great apartments. Highly recommended. 4 Euro charge for the underground car park seems a bit petty! Breakfast also very good but not cheap at 12Euros pp

title: Great place
review: We stayed in a lovely apartment. It was only 10min into Alicante by car and also 10 min drive to the Airport.  It is in the middle of nowhere but we were happy with this. The Apartment had all the amenities we needed other than a clotheshorse to hang our swimming towels and also some items we could not tumble dry. We stayed for 10 days and  were very happy

title: Overnight stop
review: Stayed at his resort before and was not dissapointed this time either. Excellent location although a little difficult to find. Apartment was excellent and well maintained with all required amenities.Bedrooms were quiet and spotless.Staff friendly and helpful. Good breakfast. Will stay again

title: Excellent value, particularly for late flight arrival at Alicante airport
review: 24 hour check in was the appeal as well as the amazing price of £48 for a two bedroomed, two bathroom apartment (2 person price) with kitchen, dining room and lounge area plus balcony overlooking the golf course. We didn't make the most of it because we arrived in the early hours and left mid morning but we enjoyed a good night's sleep (very quiet), a brief walk through the gardens and had a coffee by the pool which looked fine. Taxi was 18 euros at 1am, including a tip.

title: Great Value for Money, but slight improvements required
review: Stayed for two nights, which cost £99 - absolute bargain considering! The room itself was perfectly adequate, with an apartment type setting. Good quality room, however noticed a few things that could have been improved.  Negatives:  - Shower wasn't brilliant (temperature fluctuated a lot)   - No hair dryer in the room (room service was poor, took 3 phone calls to get one)   Positives:  - Food was good (recommend the croquettes) - Views from our room (217) and size of the apartment - Close vicinity to the airport (10 min drive) but a little out of town (car required)  Would stay again if the price was the same, but i'd look to see if there was a better alternative first.

title: 5 nights in luxary
review: The hotel was more than we could have ever dreamed! We visited mid June and it was perfectly quiet. The 2 pools are huge and the sunbeams were comfy - although a few could do with being fixed as they were a bit wonky! The apartment was perfect, really modern and spacious and was cleaned/new towels every day. The food? Where to start! We paid hardly anything to upgrade to half board and gosh it was worth it! Breakfast was great with lots of fruit, cereal, bread, meats and pastries to choose from but dinner was out of this world! A starter, main course, dessert and glass of wine was included - with choices consisting of steak, duck, cod, cuttlefish and much more, Portions were huge and it tasted amazing - i couldn't fault the service either!   This resort is perfect for a little…

title: Peaceful Gem, away from it all
review: We stayed here as a family of 2 adults and 3 children (2,6,9) in a very spacious 2 bedroom apartment. Please ignore any bad reviews about the kitchen equipment!! There are plenty of plates, bowls, glasses, pots, pans, even a blender!! A full size kettle, iron and hair dryer are available on request from reception at no extra cost. A full size fridge and freezer is great for all the lollies, (unfortunately, they didn't sell any at the bar/restaurant, they'd have made a fortune). The apartments are HUGE!! The biggest we've ever stayed in. Cleaned really well every day and towels changed too. The pool was a bit dirty with leaves when we arrived but this was rectified really quickly and it was kept very clean for the remainder of our stay.  The restaurant food was fantastic, we were…

title: A few nice holes but not as good as others in the area.
review: The course was in good condition but perhaps not as interesting a design as some of the others in the area. Quite a few dogleg holes which make club selection and course management important but overall I think there are more interesting courses. That said we had a good day the course was in good condition and the staff were friendly.

title: Absolutely fantastic
review: Having checked out of the absolutely awful vivood hotel nr guadalese early we were looking for somewhere near Alicante  to stay and happened upon this great place. We got a huge three bedroom apparent for only 150 Euros for a night at the last minute. Apparent had everything you would need to live there for a longer term let. Has two great pools in beautifully landscaped gardens one of the pools is one of the longest I have seen in a hotel. Situated about 10 mins from the airport and surrounded by a golf course so very green unlike surrounding countryside. Very peaceful and tranquil spot. Has restaurants in main building and at the golf course club house which is very short drive - club house at this time of year only did lunch but main building open for dinner and breakfast as…

title: Quite accomodation just outside Alicante
review: Spent a lovely few days here. Its a gof resort so alot of couples there to golf. We just wanted something quiter and away from all the hustle and bustle. Its 10 minutes drive outside Alicante central and only 10 minutes from the airport. We used taxis to get around.about €15 each time.suited us fine The apartments are great.spacious and modern.the kitchen looks to have all you would need to make meals but we ate out every night. The breakfast buffet is huge and plenty to choose from. The pools (theres 2) arent the nicest ive seen.but perfect for cooling off none the less. Staff at the hotel are very accomodating and friendly. Theres wifi available in all the apartments also. The t.v channels were all in spanish but after a while messing with the remote i managed to change the…

title: Amazing apartments. I love it
review: Huge apartment with all amenities for 90 euros. Room for up to 6 people for that price. Near the airport and on a golf. Love the atmosphere with the pools. The restaurant is really good too. The tapas are really tasty.

title: Brilliabt
review: This place is a great find (once we found it after google maps sent us on a MASSIVE detour..).  The room was amazing, huge and well appointed, roof terrace and lovely balcony.  The food in the restaurant was really good.  You'll note my love (or otherwise) of food from my previous reviews... This place was brilliant... The desserts were not as good as the mains but the mains were just amazing (reminded us of Masterchef food). Breakfast was good too, the pool was too nippy for us but I think it just takes a few more days sun and it would be perfect...  Go!  We'll be back!

title: Nice Hotel with appartment rooms, a tiny bit tired in places, but great value for money.
review: Overall the hotel was great value for money. The apartment was huge, having separate rooms and a living space is much nicer than just a room. Overall, pretty clean and tidy.  The room could have done with a bit more of a clean in a few places, and a few bits are looking a bit tatty around the place. There were plenty of facilities, but it lacked much cutlery if you wanted to cater for more than a couple of people. Would have been nice to have Washing up liquid and a cloth rather than having to find a supermarket and buy them but it's not the end of the world. Take a teatowel if you want to dry dishes. Take a beach towel if you want one for the pool. We asked Reception for a kettle and this was supplied without hassle The TV's did need re-tuning, but only took a minute.  Mainly…

title: If you want only to play golf and nothing else
review: There were 6 of us staying here one night to catch a flight from the nearby airport in the morning. At a glance the apartment we had (three bedrooms, two bathrooms, living room, kitchen) was really nice but getting a closer look revealed a lot of unpleasant things. Towels felt moist as if not dried properly. Or maybe they had been dried but taken here they've gathered moist from the air. Just thinking because nothing seemed to dry here and after showering there was a large pool of water right on the floor in our bedroom. It came under the bathroom wall... not even the door area but I really mean under the wall. And if all that water at all times never dries up properly... I don't want to think all the moulds growing up here...   Kitchen also looked nice but quick look around and…

title: Oasis
review: Stayed here for one night to catch an early flight. Good option, less than 15’ to the airport. But, I it also was a test for a longer stay. And although the resort is fine, the apartments very nice and the atmosphere relaxing, I will not take a holiday here. The main reason is that the larger area is rather depressing, a crossroad of highways and industrial sites. Downtown Alicante is about 20’ by car, and here a second reason I will not be coming back …never seen anything more utterly ugly than this stroke of coastline.

title: Winter Break
review: Excellent apartment clean and well equipped, even had a built in dishwasher full oven and electric hob. No kettle strangely so we boiled water in a saucepan. Wonderful location on site overlooking the huge pool.

title: Could be so much better
review: We spent a week in a two-bed apartment at El Plantio. The place is pretty isolated and you even need a car to get from the apartment complex to the golf course. The apartments are large and well appointed, although the kitchen is missing such obvious equipment as a kettle, toaster or coffee maker. The main problem is that the apartments have tiled floors and have poor sound insulation, so they are really noisy. The restaurant and bar are both in one fairly small room and are only open until midday and then again in the evening from 18.30. If you want anything to eat or drink outside these times then you have to go to the golf club, which as I already mentioned means a car ride. The café there is only open until 16.30, so there is a two hour window when you can't get anything.…

title: GOLF BREAK IN THE SUN
review: Stayed at the El Plantio apartments for a 5 day golf break in early march..Golf course was a good test for all levels with water on many holes close to airport so taxi is fine .walk way from apartments to pro shop and can leave clubs in secure area if you do not want to keep them in room .club house was good ,especially the pizza with prices fair.apartments were lovely,clean ,comfortable and very spacious.had dinner in restaurant every night with good food and wine.staff very good,friendly and happy. would recommened to any golfer wishing for a game of golf in the sun where you get a nice bit of roll on your ball compared to the wet winter fairways  of the uk.

title: Good and value for money
review: We stayed in a first floor apartment which I would recommend for balcony views over pool etc. The apartment itself was very comfortable and surprisingly large. The staff were very helpful and friendly creating a pleasant atmosphere. The breakfast room does not open until 0730 hours though so if you want breakfast before your round of golf make sure your tee time is no sooner than 0830 hours. The golf course itself is great fun,, some interesting holes and in good condition when we visited in early March. The clubhouse bar serves reasonably priced food which is of a decent standard. Will I be going back?? Most definitely 😊 oh and if you don't plan to travel and are just going for Golf get a taxi from the airport, it's a 10 minute ride. Enjoy, we did.

title: Excellent value for money
review: We visit El Plantio once a year. Friendly staff and spacious (huge) clean apartments. Quiet location with nice pool and playground for the kids. Breakfast has significantly improved over the past years. Excellent freshness and choice. Close to the airport but you'll need a rental car to get around.

title: Lovely hotel and apartments
review: Really good quality apartments for a family holiday. The apartment and complex was of a high quality standard.   Pools were lovely and it was never too busy. The restaurant was great for lunches dinner and even takeaway items.  You will need a car as the hotel is not central. We would use the complex again and would recommend to our family and friends.

title: Good location for airport
review: Went twice recently. Both times for one night stop overs on airport journeys. The first time. The evening meal was really good. The apartment was clean & tidy. Only niggle was door to ensuite didn't shut fully. Second time. The meal was poor. Because the dining room was catering for two large parties, an outside wooden table was put into dining room for us. 4 soiled placemats were put on this table. (We didn't merit a table cloth, like another couple similarly placed on an outside table). Service was slow, but not enough staff to cater for two large parties, and ordinary diners. Again the door to the ensuite wouldn't shut properly, and seemed awkward on it's runners.

title: Emergency stopover was a delight!
review: So we had a last minute change of plan at the airport and needed a hotel last minute that was close.  Following a quick online search we found El Plantio. It was cheap (€86 for a 2 bed apartment) and less than 5 mins away from the airport and thus ticked both boxes.  It turned out to be a little gem - even for us non golfers! Our apartment was superb - a real little home from home with a large balcony and pool views.   We ate in the restaurant which was okay however the service was slow (one poor girl left to cover every single table). The bar menu reasonable the a la Carte expensive.  Staff were excellent and if golf is your thing then I'm sure you'd have a roaring time here.

title: Large apartment next to golf course
review: El plantio golf resort apartment hotel is near the airport and a shopping mall ( Puerto de Alicante). But its preferable to have your own car. Which by the way is inexpensive in Spain. By car it takes 7 minutes to nearest mall and Mercadona supermarket. The mall includes a large Carrefour. We got an apartment in building 7 next to the golf course. Very nice views to the golf course. But ask for your type of apartment / view. Most buildings are facing south, while some, like building 7, face west. With direct sunshine from about 1 pm. If you want as much sunshine as possible ask for southfacing apartment.   The apartments are cleaned professionally every single day !  And you can buy a cleaning kit for just 3 Euros. With all the detergents you need plus more.   We ate only 1 time…

title: Wonderful Golf Holiday.
review: Just returned from a one week golf holidays in Alicante. Its much cheaper to book with breakfast included, otherwise its really cheap to make your own breakfast as the apartment have all the required utensils in the kitchen. The apartment really feels like home with all the necessary facilities. Rooms were cleaned everyday. Breakfast was ok. The hotel receptionists were very helpful and pleasant especially thanks to Jessica, Victoria and Aillin. Golf course was really beautiful and breathtaking except for the unfriendly receptionist there.  LOOKS LIKE THEY ARE NOT HAPPY TO ATTEND TO CUSTOMERS :( Rented a car and was very convenient to drive around.

title: Spacious well maintained apartments!
review: Wonderful apartments located between Alicante Airport and Alicante. Stayed for three nights with family. Booked second apartment for my parents. Staff were wonderful. Facilitated us in locating both apartments close together. Lovely grounds. Car vital as no bus service to the hotel. Would go back.

title: Good base for a golfing vcation
review: The resort is located between the airport and center of Alicante. The three of us had a big apartment with three bedrooms, two bathrooms, living room, dining room, kitchen and balcony. We even had a private roof terrace. The apartment had everything we needed. They have also added free WiFi in all the apartments, so you no longer have to go to the reception. There is plenty of parking around the apartment buildings if you have a car. The entire resort was very quiet during our stay: no noisy neighbors or wild parties or screaming children. Breakfast was included and was a bit more than OK with warm dishes (eggs, bacon, beans, potatoes), cheese, ham, various types of bread, fruits, cereals, cakes and pancakes.  Downsides: dinner in the restaurant was very medicore. If you want to…

title: Ideal
review: The apartment was perfect for a short weekend break. Very spacious and clean and nice balcony. Beds were comfortable and it was very quiet at night so easy to sleep. You definitely need a car if you stay here as nothing around to walk too.

title: Very nice
review: This hotel have very nice appartments with big balkonys. Very well designed rooms with full kitchen. The golf couse is really good and the location of the hotel give you fast axcess to the other golfcouses in the area. A rental car is needed if you want to go to beach ( 7min) ,town (10min), airport (10 min)

title: El plantío golf restaurante
review: Four of us ordered the Hamburguesa Cerdo in the Club house restaurant after the round of golf. Our surprise was unison as we watched a small slice of meat and a few chips 🍟 on the plate before us. We complained about paying 9.5 euros fir something so utterly cheap in presentation and substance, but to no avail.  The waiter said he was only the waiter and told us to write a complaint which we did.

title: Very difficult for anyone disabled
review: El Plantio is a very nice place to stay - near the airport so ideal for a morning flight, lovely surroundings, good restaurant, pleasant staff. But this time I stayed with a disabled friend and we got one of the apartments adapted for a disabled person with what looked like fine disabled friendly bathrooms. It turned into a nightmare as the bathrooms flooded the apartment when the shower was on and rendered the whole area a slippery, dangerous environment for both of us. Some serious rethinking needs as to design and safety of these bathrooms. We would have been better off just taking an ordinary apartment with a walkin shower. Actually it was so bad it ruined what otherwise would have been a perfect stay.

title: Spacious apartment but car needed and lots of frustration elements
review: Located far from town and a car is an absolute must if you stay at this resort. You stay in the middle of nowhere, quiet and extremely dark at night. Professional pictures from management are photoshopped.  Apartment is older and more worn out. It is spacious, but cleaning is not good enough. Many of us got allergic reaction from the aircondition/heating.  Kitchen is modern, but lots of kitchenware were missing and causing frustration and slow cooking. The most frustrating was the hot water. Hot water was almost not functioning. The temperature was maximum 40 celsius. After complaining it got hotter, about 60 celsius, but then the pressure was extremely low and it water temperature was hoing up and down. At last our children didnt want to shower, because it could turn from hot…

title: Luxury
review: The rooms and facilities in the rooms were superb.  Decoration was excellent.  The restaurant was good value and freshly cooked.  Unfortunately the hotel was a long way from anything and pretty isolated.  We used the hotel as we were flying off early the next morning.

title: Inside and out of a 3 bed apartment
review: 4th time here . Love it each time we're here. No matter what time of year these apartments make you feel well relaxed and rested. I have written on each visit so won't write anymore here. Apart from good value for money.

title: Lovely resort but....
review: Stayed for 1 night before flying out of airport early next morning - for what we wanted it was perfect. Arrived at 12 and got straight into our room with pool right outside.  Apartment was clean and quiet and well furnished.  We ate at the restaurant which was reasonably priced and the food was fine.  Would say that for a longer stay there is nothing to do anywhere near- we drove for 5 minutes just to find a petrol station.   You wouldn't be able to self cater - the kitchen was very poorly equipped - no kettle or toaster, only 1 bread knife and a few bits of cutlery, crockery. We only made sandwiches for lunch and just managed to do this. No dishwasher tablets, washing up liquid, dish cloths or tea towels so you can't even tidy up.  We would use again as and airport hotel as it…

title: Disappointing
review: Very pleasant location but overall rather disappointing. Pre-ordered room with view and a kettle but received neither! Rooms OK but finished to a mediocre standard with attention to details missing. Towel rails loose, no basin plug, door jamming on floor,etc. Breakfast poor. Hot food(bacon,eggs,beans)inedibly cold-even restocked items arrived cold from kitchen! Jam and marmalade extremely poor, cheap quality items also inedible. Machine supplied coffee also very poor standard. Attitude of staff in golf pro shop not pleasant. Other staff very amenable. Great shame. Lovely location and potentially good resort spoiled by simple failings.

title: One of the best apartments I've stayed at
review: The El Plantio resort was one of the most beautiful places I have stayed at. The apartment was spacious and modern. The terrace was large and overlooked the golf course. The surrounding views were delightful. The pool was large the facilities were great. The downside was (especially on the weekend) the golfers would come quite close to our apartment so you could hear the golf buggies etc. Sometimes you could hear the apartment above (we were on the ground floor). The resort is a little hard to find also.   Overall it was fantastic I'll never forget my stay here it was beautiful and I will definitely be staying again.

title: ONE NIGHT ONLY
review: stayed at the el plantio golf resort for one night as we landed at Alicante very late at night !!!!!!!!!! staff were excellent and showed us to our room 6 berth promptly room was spotless with all mod con's. breakfast was plentiful and price very reasonable all in all recommended .

title: Convenient for airport and Alicante, lovely surroundings but al a carte food pretty awful
review: Modern, spacious apartment with good size patio- only 2 chairs and no table! Not very easy to find resort but once you do it is well located. Dinner menu offered quite strange dishes and were poorly cooked, however Duty manager very responsive to our complaint . Wine very good . Pleasant but would agree with some other reviews that some issues need attention, particularly the quality of food.

title: Holiday
review: Very pleasant location but overall rather disappointing. Pre-ordered room with view and a kettle but received neither! Rooms OK but finished to a pretty mediocre standard with attention to details missing. Towel rails loose, no basin plug, door jamming on floor-that kind of stuff. Breakfast poor. Hot food(bacon,eggs,etc)inedibly cold-even restocked items arrived cold from kitchen. Preserves(jam, marmalade)extremely poor, cheap quality items-again inedible. Machine supplied coffee also low standard. Attitude of staff in golf pro shop not pleasant. Other staff amenable though. Great shame, lovely location and potentially good resort spoiled by simple failings.

title: Not ideal for couples
review: The resort is pleasant enough and a short drive from Alicante which has some very nice shops and restaurants at its centre.  Our apartment was really nice, maybe recently refurbished. Modern and comfortable with an ensuite for the master bedroom and a very nice new kitchen. Nice as the kitchen is ours lacked anything beyond basic cutlery, poor for a self catering apartment, we had to buy a lot of the kitchen basics that you would expect to be provided. Obviously dependant on time of year but be prepared to spend a fair amount of time dealing with mosquitos. The small blood spats on the walls and ceilings left behind by previous occupants evidence of their issues.  Part of our reason for choosing a golf resort was that as a couple we hoped it would be a more relaxing, adult,…

title: Spacious, friendly and really quite laid back
review: We booked one night here, en route to our holiday destination.  Great apartment, very spacious with a balcony and access to a roof terrace.  Everything was squeaky clean and worked well.  The restaurant was good and not over-priced; the included buffet breakfast was a feast! We arrived somewhat tired and travel-weary and had some trouble finding our apartment, but we received the necessary help from the friendly receptionist. El Plantio is not the easiest place to find, but worth the effort for a very laid-back short stay outside the city.  Imagine that there's easy access from airport by taxi (though we drove).

title: Big apartments, friendly staff, nice pool
review: It was a nice place, very good for kids. The apartments were huge and was good value for money. I cant say it was luxury but a good 3* hotel. Would recommend for families. Is slightly out of town so you would need a car. The staff were very friendly and helpful, Elena and Javier went out of their way to really help us and Jorge in the restaurant made our dinner very entertaining.

title: You Decide
review: Whilst i cant really recommend these apartments I cant say they are too bad either. Spacious and clean they are although a bit tired looking, they could do with a refurb really. If your thinking that as the Apartments are on a golf course they will be peaceful Think again. Kids everywhere which for the life of me i couldnt understand as you are miles from anywhere and there are no kids clubs no activities for children. Why people with small children would want to go there i dont know. So there you have it an okish apartment surrounded by a Lush green golf Course with Two unheated swimmimg pools and lots of screaming kids.

title: Planning a return trip!
review: Just back from 10 nights at these apartments.  We were allocated a ground floor apartment with a HUGE terrace.  The kitchen was adequately stocked and we already knew to take a tea towel and kettle.  We also already knew to take our own beach towels as I had emailed ahead to find out.  I found it strange that apartments that can take four or even six people only have 2 chairs on the terrace/balcony.  All the reception staff and most of the waiting staff spoke very good English and were extremely helpful.  The staff whose English wasn't "very good" still had "good" English, so never a problem.  There was some reserving of sun beds which was annoying, but there simply aren't enough to go round.  We hardly sat around the pool but after a day out, it was nice to come back for a…

title: Very pleasant stay
review: Could not fault the apartments very spacious, modern, cleaned every day, free wifi. The pools were lovely having lifeguards on duty and poolside bars a bonus. The restaurant served good food friendly waiters and good service. The only down side is that it is in the middle of know where so a car is definitely necessary.

title: Good but could be great....
review: Myself and 3 friends stayed in a 3 bed apartment in El Plantio earlier this month.  There are so many positives about El Plantio but a few things let down the overall experience.  First, the positives:  the apartment itself was large, well designed and spotlessly clean.  The first apartment we were allocated was on the ground floor and a little dark so when we asked to move to a higher floor, the reception staff were friendly and helpful and managed to get us moved.  All of the staff we dealt with were lovely - a special mention to Jorge in the restaurant who was very helpful about speaking to the chef about vegetarian options for one of our party and provided a fun, friendly service.  The breakfast was good - lots of choice including fresh fruit and freshly cooked items and it…

title: Promised more than it delivered
review: I stayed at El Plantio for three nights with a small group of friends in one of the upstairs apartments. As other reviewers have said, it's convenient for the airport (about 10 mins, c.15 euros in a taxi), and again about 10 mins drive into Alicante, which is reflected in the price.  On the plus side: - the apartments were fairly clean, spacious and quiet (the metal shutters at night really helped to cut out the light). Ours had a nice balcony for sitting out.  - the two pools were nice, heated to a pleasant temperature  - the breakfast buffet was great, lots of fresh fruit, fresh juice and pastries etc. with a few cooked items and cold meat / cheese  - the reception staff were friendly and helpful  On the minus side: - not enough pool loungers! Which led to various pool-lounger…

title: Great stay for a few chilled out days
review: Great 4 day stay at the resort, 10 min taxi ride from the Airport & 10-15 min taxi ride into Alicante . Apartments were amazing, very clean and spacious. Maid service everyday which was good. A few more kitchen utensils would have been good but we managed. Pools were nice but not kept very clean due to the grass surrounding them , there was a lot of this in the pool. Nearest Supermarket is around a 10 min taxi ride. The resort could do with a little onsite shop so that you can stock up on essentials. Husband and friends impressed with the golf course. Did not try the restaurant but friends in the group said the lunch time menu was good and better than the evening one. All in all this was a fab place to chill out and relax.

title: Doesn't worth the money.
review: I was with my family (2kids 2adults)first impression was ok,but in the night we discover ants in our apartment(beds,table)and we have been bite by ants,we had a very noisy nights,the person who collects the kitchen rubbish came almost every night after 22.00,they make noise, spoke very loudly,we hear even music at 02.00 night,so no  sleeping well,customer service very poor,not to many choices from restaurant,and expensive,you can go in the town just with a taxi,who came already with €5- €6 on watch.The only good thing about this resort it's the swimming pool.

title: Lovely rooms
review: On arrival (evening time) we found the reception was badly sign posted.  Reception staff were very polite and helpful.  4oclock check in I think is rather late even though full use of the facilities is available.  The rooms were lovely, clean and very spacious.  Unfortunately no kettle was in the room nor were there any dish cloths or tea towels.  An ironing board was provided yet no iron was.   I did think the glass on the balcony could have been cleaned.  Views of the golf course we're fabulous.  The hotel itself was out of the way, and I would definitely recommend hiring a car if staying here. We booked here knowing that we going to be out of the way - after all which golf course isn't !   Pools were lovely - yet could have been spruced up a little, chipped paint in the pool…

title: Great
review: Great hotel to stay. Great nice staff, poolarea and excellent rooms! Good place to stay at when you have had enough with Alicante! We stayed in Alicante at a hotel without a pool and that is tough in the heat. Closer to the airport but you need a rental if you want to go to Alicante. We didn't play golf but we loved it anyway!

title: Nice hotel but isolated & the golf course was dreadful.
review: nice hotel with excellent apartments but the resort is isolated & a car is essential. The dining was good & the staff very friendly & helpful. The downsides were that we had to ask for kettle & hairdryer & there was a distinct lack of sun loungers by the pool & the majority of those there were faulty. We had booked to play the adjoining golf course. Firstly there was no transportation to the golf club house which was approximately 1 mile away. We had to carry our golf bags over 3 holes to get to the clubhouse. When we got there we informed that holes 10 to 18 were closed for essential work to be carried out. There was no reduction in our green fee the only compromise was that we weren't charged for our buggy. The 9 holes open were in a very poor condition with one green out of…

title: Well worth a visit!!!
review: We stayed as a family (kids age 10 & 8) for two weeks in August!  It was definitely the best holiday we have had for a while.  Both pools were big and clean and had lifeguards. Sunbeds a were a bit sparse and annoyingly some people did the towel saving which was really annoying when they weren't even at the pool!  Our apartment was a 2 bedroom ground floor one which was very spacious and had a great view over the golf course and mountains. We didn't have any problem with wifi connection at all in fact on some days we were all using it!  We stayed on a b&b holiday which was very nice lots of choice and was refreshed frequently.  We had lunch a few times in the hotel and it was very tasty and the portion sizes were very big. The pictures below were the brownie and the carrot cake…

title: Worth a visit
review: Stayed for one night as this place is near airport and we had early flight. Efficient check in wonderful apartment and amazing gourmet food well with a visit.  The apartment was fully equipped and sparkling clean  A wonderful place to stay

title: Great stay apart from lack of sun beds !!
review: Great place to stay off the beaten track. Villas very clean and loads of space, staff very friendly on arrival. Restaurant really good- plenty of choice for breakfast. Bar meals at lunch time great value with friendly service. My only big disappointment is that around both separate pools there are hardly any sun beds! Unless you get up at the crack of dawn and put a towel down you could find yourself literally lying on the grass around the pool! I really don't understand due to the size of the place and amount of villas why there are not more. As a family of four we only ever used two as we felt guilty so others could have some!

title: Disappointing Overall !!
review: We were really looking forward to this hotel after reading all the reviews ! WRONG ! Where do I begin : ... Nice apartment with very minimal self catering equipment . The apartment was nice but very worn in areas of it , especially our ensuite . No kettle , toaster , dishes for oven , tea towels , cloths , very very minimal ! We went out and bought everything , You definitely need a car if staying there . There is no shop on site at all. We stayed in a two bed . My god the noise from the apartment above was unbearable at night . Every slight movement in rooms above and it was like it was in your own room . I was talking to another guest and she said same thing , if your not on top level it's horrendous with noise , She was woken up in middle of the night , thinking someone was…

title: Lovely and quiet place- not only for golfing
review: Lovely and quiet place- not only for golfing  The flat is really big. We had a 3- bedroom flat for 1 (2) adult and 2 children. The bedrooms are spacious and the beds are lovely. The kitchen is nice, but not well equipped. But it does not matter so much- if you miss anything, the nice girls in the reception will bring you what you need.  Living room is with a larger TV and sofa area. Also there are a dining area.  The flat also had a washing machine and a tumble dryer.  Also there are a quite large terrace. We had a nice view to all the lovely plants and the swimmingpool. We had a quite wild- growing brugmansia right outside the terrace, which for us is exotic.  And the air condition was so good!  We had some problems with locking the terrace doors, but we just solved it with…

title: Great resort
review: We stayed here for a week in a 2 bedroom apartment. Very spacious and well kept. The kitchen was lovely but lacked what I would think we're basic requirements such as a kettle, toaster, and oven gloves. The apartment was big enough for 6 people yet the teapot was for 2 cups, cutlery was mismatched. The terrace was spacious but only 2 chairs were supplied so we had to use a dinning chair. During the busy season I suspect there would be a lack of sun beds and they really do need to put parasols up as the heat was very strong and this is dangerous. Several people brought small parasols from the hypermarket. We used the restaurant twice and found it to be good value. It was my sons birthday out there and I had arranged a cake for him. The waiters were very kind and made a fuss of…

title: I would love to come here again
review: Amazing hotel, perfect holiday. I went in September and it wasn't jam packed with people or noisy. The staff are helpful and the food is nice. Only slight down side is location, its very out of the way so you can end up spending a lot of money on taxis, its probably better to hire a car if you wish to explore.

title: wow !!
review: Stayed here 1 night but wish we could have stayed longer ! We had a huge two bed two bathroom apartment, with a kitchen, lounge and balcony.  The pools are great for the children with different depths, for different capabilities.  Food for breakfast was lovely and lots of choice. Wish we could have stayed longer, we wil be back !!!!

title: Fab place to stay
review: Fell in love with this hotel. The apartments were spacious. We had a 2 bedroom  apartment for the 2 of us overlooking the golf course with magnificent views. Everyone in the hotel was fiendly. Even got invited for a dance with a wedding party that was going on at the same time as our stay! We didnt eat at the restaurant., so i cannot comment on their food. Instead we choose to go to the local Lldl for the basics and ate out most of the time.  A car is a must

title: Great place to stay
review: We stayed at this beautiful place for 3 days in July 2015. The appartment was spotlessly clean, the swimming pool(s) were absolutely brilliant and the buffet breakfast which we had booked in our deal had a lot of choice. I would definitely give this place 5 stars and will return again.

title: Excellent stay
review: Stayed one night enroute from Alicante. Provided with 3 bed apartment; beautifully clean and modern with all mod cons. And great views over golf course. Hole 5. Staff very friendly and attentive and were able to check in at midday rather than wait until 4pm. Great meals from restaurant...salads and pizzas very good. Breakfast buffet had very wide choice. 2 great swimming pools although watch out for those who bag a sunbed before breakfast with their towels!!  Booked through Expedia and got a great deal. You ideally need a car as its a bit remote; about 30 mins from Alicante and Elche. Highly recommend it.

title: Delightful!
review: Fantastic, well equipped apartment at a lovely resort. We were there for a week and enjoyed every minute. The restaurant at the resort was great.  We explored the town of Alicante and the local area so feel that hiring a car was essential. Only slight niggle was the ridiculous use of towels to 'book' sun beds at the pool - meaning that for a large part of the day sun beds were lying unused!

title: Great hotel and golf resort
review: Very modern and spacous rooms, we had a suite with 2 beds, kitchen, lounge and dining room. Staff helpful. Great room, once I worked our air-con controls. Used it as convent for Alicante airport, when we had early start, but many use as longer stay. 5/6 Apartment blocks with big pool and 2 restaurants and gym on site. Not within walking distance of anywhere. Rooms are at least 4 star

title: Excellent
review: I stayed here when visiting a friend that lives in Alicante. This was perfect as very close to the airport and not too far from Alicante.  The apartments were spacious and very clean. The staffers very helpful and always smiling. I wasn't too keen on the breakfast buffet but being self catering, this didn't matter.  The location is fantastic if you want peace and quiet. I have nothing bad to say. Will definitely visit again.

title: Very good value for money
review: The staff are very helpful and friendly we travelled in a group of 4 adult and had a lovely stay in the hotel for the second time. The breakfast was lovely with a great selection of hot and cold food. The man serving us breakfast alway had a smile on his face and made a effort to talk to everyone. And had great time for the children. The only draw back to the hotel is the location you would definitely need to hire a car.

title: golf holiday what a great place
review: absolutely fab accommodation spot on all facilities available apartment spacious and clean even had a washing machine and dryer staff friendly and helpful. food new caterers so food menu was extensive and of good standard close to alicante for days out and close to airport for transfers or car hire.  suggest a car needed as no nightlife .....2 pools apts overlook the course perrrfecrt for groups of golfers. will go back as golf 36 euros a round and buggy 20 euros cheap as chips course great for all handicappers as some challenging holes with water hazards if you want to take them on  highly reccomended apt hotel and the course brilliant holiday

title: Very comfortable establishment
review: Needed accommodation near to the airport for our last evening. We booked a 3 bed unit which met our expectations. The view from the lounge looked straight out onto wonderful gardens overlooking the golf course. There was a washing machine and tumble dryer in the utility room which meant the washing was all done before returning. The pool area was large surrounded by lawns.   The price paid included breakfast and this represented excellent value. You do need a car when visiting and its worth paying the 3 euros per day for the underground secure car park as you get direct access to your unit.  Air conditioning worked very well in the apartment and the furnishings were top quality.

title: Excellent for a relaxing week
review: My partner and I stayed at the hotel with 2 families. While the men played golf at surrounding courses the rest of us kicked back and chilled round the pool. There were plenty of sun beds available so no need for anyone to get up early and throw towels on them! The children in our party enjoyed endless hours in the pool and there is a playground if you have younger ones. It was very hot when we visited and there were no umbrellas so if shade was needed you have to go into the poolside bar - which wasn't too much of a difficulty! The apartment was amazing. Fully equipped modern kitchen, big bedrooms, a huge en suite and lovely lounge diner leading onto a big balcony overlooking a second pool was great. Our friends had a three bed apartment which came with a roof terrace! To be…

title: Excellent for Families with Children
review: We recently stayed at El Plantio Golf Resort with our small children. The apartments and the apartments were simply fantastic. Our children loved the combined pool and play area.   The breakfast was quite adequate and right in from of the pool area to enjoy the view.  We already have our next reservation there. We highly recommend the stay there.   The only issue we had was a problem with the WiFi coverage in our apartment. Other than this the stay was absolutely fantastic.

title: Beautiful apartments
review: Me and my partner visited this hotel back in August 2013 first impressions of this hotel was oh gosh it's in the middle of nowhere but we didn't let this put us off. The hotel receptionist was rude and unhelpful when we didn't know where our apartment was she just pointed and said over there. Anyway we didn't let this spoil our trip. So when we got inside of the apartment it was fabulous. We couldn't believe how big and great value for money this apartment was. It has every single thing you need for a self catering stay down to the smallest detail. The apartments where very clean they was  even a washing machine and tumble dryer. The pool side was very quite and nothing to do apart from read and relax which was not to our cup of tea so we went out most days which cost us an arm…

title: Recent stay here
review: We stayed here with another couple, in separate apartments.  Beautiful resort. Large clean apartment overlooking the golf course. Rooms cleaned daily to high standard. Apartments had laundry rooms with washer and separate drier. Kitchen had a dishwasher, large fridge with freezer. Basically a fully fitted kitchen with ALL equipment that you would need. We were there on a bed and breakfast basis. The breakfasts there were hot and plentiful. The two pools were very clean and well maintained. Bar service there was good also. WIFI worked everywhere but, the ground floor apartment where my friends were. We had a car which you need. Although taxis could be ordered at a cost. Would recommend and stay again.

title: El Plantio - Nice apartment
review: Me and my husband stayed at El Plantio golf resort for one night. The apartment was very big and clean and service at the reception was also good. I can just complain about the wifi which did not work in our apartment, worked fine in the garden.The golf course is not the best but ok.

title: Relaxing stay and good value for money out of season
review: I enjoyed staying in this resort, the staff was friendly and very helpful. The apartment we stayed in was overly spacious for the two of us as it could easily sleep a family of 4/6. The apartment had a lovely balcony overlooking the golf course, it was peaceful and it had most of the amenities in the kitchen. I would recommend that you would need a car to access the resort and to get around, the kitchen could do with a few added items such as a kettle, oven gloves, tea towel especially as it's a self catering apartment. All in all I would definitely go back in the warmer months and enjoy the pool!

title: Relaxing Resort
review: Stayed there 4 nights at end of April in the 3 bedrooms appartment , which was quiet spacious with good facilities such as complete kitchen, washer & dryer , dishwasher however furniture is aging., staff are friendly , swimming pool is nice. Belfast buffet needs improvement in terms of quality and variety  , if you don't eat pork cold cuts , you don't have many choices.

title: Great value for money
review: Very spacy apartment for very good price. Stuff very friendly. Breakfast was good but, sorry to say, the dinner was not (only restaurant nearby). Easy to reach the golfcourse.  Busstop to city center Alicante only 10 min.away.

title: Good value for the appartment but food for dinner not good
review: We had a late flight into Alicante & this place seemed to be a sensible stop over the the night. Apartment was good & clean and we would return to that at teh Late rooms price. However, the food when we ordered dinner was not good. Maybe they wanted to go home as we were the only people there.  Breakfast the next day was good ad a different Team running the show so miles better.  Without a sat nav we had problems finding it

title: Still great value for money
review: My fourth visit here. My friend sayd he wouldnt never dare to book apartment with this low price. Now he will:). Im sure ill be back next year. These roomy flats were again clean and tidy. Only negative thing was trouble with terrace door lock. golf course was under maintenance but playable anyway.

title: November 2014
review: Stayed here in November 2014 with 5 other male friends as part of a golfing holiday.  The apartment itself was fantastic. We had a 3 bedroom, which easily slept 6. It was huge and nearly brand new, with large lounge, dining and kitchen area. Wifi worked fine in our room. The two pools were nice, and the restaurant was good, although we only ate there for lunch.  As all the other reviews state, a car is a must if stopping here. Taxi to Benidorm costs about 75euros each way, and you can only have 3 passengers per taxi due to Spanish law! Alicante is nice, was a little quiet though. Taxi into Alicante cost around 15euros.  Great place to stay if your are playing golf, lots of courses near by and the accommodation itself is great.

title: Nice family place
review: Nice, calm, spacious family place and good value for money hotel. Spacious rooms, equipped kitchen, washing maschine/dryer in the rental apartment. Very clean. The closest beach (Urbanova) is some 15 min. drive from the resort. The restaurant  at the resort  not really suitable for families as you wait for some 30 min and the choice is rather poor. The restaurant in the golf area is a bit better. (fortunately the kitchen was fully functional). Wi-fi available but very weak capacity...

title: Terrible service
review: The hotel and the rooms deserves 6 stars, but im sorry to say that the two male waiters who worked in the restaurant and in the pub made the stay horrible. They both where rude when we tried to order food and drinks and used up to 35 minutes to serve drinks. We stayed There for 4 days, but will never visit them again i'm afraid.

title: Amazing Apartments
review: Stayed here overnight and would have happily stayed longer. Was expecting a pokey, basic, old fashioned apartment. (I didn't book it and hadn't seen pictures before we arrived) and I couldn't have been more wrong. Really modern apartments with everything you could need. Ideal for a family holiday as the apartments are very spacious and there are play facilities for the children. Hope to go back for longer.

title: good holiday
review: Stayed there for one week with family in early September.  We booked an apartment with two bedrooms. The apartment was spacious, it had a living-room with a sofa and armchair and there was a dining area as well for six people. The apartment was well-equipped (microwave, dishwasher, washing machine and dryer etc).   We did not try the restaurant at the golf course but the one at the reception area was good. What I really liked was that the beer was served in a chilled glass. The staff was nice.  We usually spent the morning at the pools and in the afternoon we drove to beaches nearby (Playa San Juan, Santa Pola).  Getting to Alicante by car takes around 10 mins.  Getting to the closest supermarket takes around 5 mins. Getting to the airport is around 10 mins.  Negative: poor wifi…

title: Call it residence, not resort
review: It's not a real resort, the only restocafè was very bad, not a little shop even to by a cigarette. The apartment was good and large. Not so bad but not a resort. I have no idea about the golf club. Bye

title: Lacked facilities and not our best holiday choice!
review: Before I go into the detail of our 10-day stay (which finished yesterday), two cautionary notes for others; Note 1) If like us, you decide to book a rental car in advance from the UK, do NOT take-out the extra damage wavier/vehicle excess insurance protection at the same time ... as your selected car rental company at Alicante Airport may not recognise or approve it and you are then faced with two options, a) leave them with a 600 Euro deposit to cover any potential damage or b) take-out their damage wavier insurance at extra cost.  No brainer ... took out their version at 90 Euros, so wasted £50 earlier back in the UK.  Not too worry!  Note 2) If like us, you punch in the resort's address into your SatNav, it will take you to the golf complex and NOT the hotel resort ... the…

title: Excellent
review: Perfect hotel and room. You cannot go wrong. Only negatives are the bar shuts at 11ish and its a little out-of-town. Its about 15 euros for a cab into main alicante for anyone wondering. About the same cost to the airport.

title: Brilliant and will stay here again
review: We came here for a low key hen party, and received excellent treatment. The hotel is a taxi ride away from the airport and town but easy to get to.   We arrived early but we're allowed to go to one room it was HUGE with washing machine, utilitity outside area big living space perfect.  Food was lovely a bit more pricy than town but great quality.  The pool was fantastic sunbeds available!   Great value for money

title: Good Hotel
review: We stayed for a week. The apartment was nice and spacious and the appliances were all working and well maintained. It was also clean and always had hot water. The pools were clean but there was never enough loungers so there was a fight for them. The staff were very nice. The food was nice but was a bit expensive. It was a quite resort but the was no entrainment in the evening so it was a little to quite. The beds weren't very comfortable and there were no hangers in the wardrobe. A car is essential as it's a long walk to the bus stop. Overall Good value, not great value.

title: Good Family Hotel
review: Stayed here for just one night due to easy access of Alicante airport for return home. Excellent modern apartments with good sized rooms and all mod cons. Only stayed one night and not sure we'd want to base ourselves there, not much around unless you're into golf. Great pool and we not too pricey on the food in the restaurant. Provided an excellent last night for us as a family of 4.

title: Great value for little money
review: Perhaps it was because we stayed outside of the high season - but we could not believe how incredibly cheap this beautiful hotel was - for a very spacious, beautifully furnished apartment with a garden and a terrace, access to the nice pool, free parking in front of the house, a good breakfast buffet. Ideal for families with small or older children and of course for golf lovers (this I assume, as I don´t play golf, but the course looked nice, and the noise from mowing the lawn did not bother us at all).   You need a car though to get around and into the city of Alicante and to the beaches. And keep in mind that in Alicante parking is difficult, or at least not cheap (in comparison to NY of course it feels almost like free parking).   There is also wireless in the house. The big…

title: Lovely spacious apartments
review: We only stayed at the resort for 24 hours but the apartments were very clean and spacious. The staff were all very friendly. The location is a bit off the beaten track so a car would be useful. The resort is only a 15 minute drive from Alicante airport.

title: A really relaxing place
review: We are currently staying at this property as I type.   The accommodation is amazing. We are in a 3bed apartment which is simply huge including 2 bathrooms and an amazing balcony. The kitchen is a full size one with dishwasher, hob, oven and microwave and all the cooking utensils you might need ( though we are here half board). There is a utility room with full size washer and tumble dryer.   There is a TV though no English channels  There is a full size lounge and dining room  There is WIFI- there was a problem with this on Friday evening as more people arrived but it is fine now as a technician addressed this problem  There are two large pools surrounded by grass and even though there are not many sun beds we have managed to get some no matter what time of the day we went down …

title: Love it.
review: Currently here with my boyfriend and it's brilliant, admittedly there has been problems like our oven didn't work but within 2 mins of calling reception someone came to fix it and it was done in 10. What's given is very basic but as long as you know that before you come then it's not an issue like a tea towel. Wifi is horrendous but I wouldn't let that put you off here. Very clean, staff are very polite and helpful, swimming pools are amazing and definitely not brown so I guess they have been painted since others have visited. Definitely need a car saying that me and my boyfriend are getting taxi's and not a problem with the airport and supermarkets 10 minutes away. Perfect for small families and couples and golfers ;)

title: Wish our one night stop could have been a week
review: Stopped here before travelling down to Mojacar and we were all extremely impressed by the lovely staff, accommodation and facilities. This will be a preferred destination for a quick weekend getaway from now on. It's only 10 mins from the airport and in the middle of nowhere. Lovely. Great little restaurant and delicious breakfast

title: Great apartment accommodation
review: Beautiful setting with golf course and no plane noise despite being 10 minutes from Alicante airport.  The rooms are two bed roomed apartments, very spacious, modern and well equipped.  Massive living room and large galley kitchen, master bedroom ensuite and second bedroom with adjoining bathroom. Large balcony with golf course views and massive pool with lovely gardens; there is a second pool but I didn't see it. I used it for an airport stopover but it would be ideal for families, especially with the kitchen facilities. A car essential as it is remote. If it was on the accommodation itself and pool area, I would give it top score but I have marked it down due to poor instructions to find the hotel, the restaurant and average customer service.  Like other people who reviewed…

title: Exceeded expectations
review: We recently returned from a weeks’ stay at this resort during the busy school ½ term week.   I was extremely impressed with this resort.  I have visited the Costa Blanca on numerous occasions as have family living over here.  I have to say this place is a real gem, a lovely green oasis.  The resort is immaculately maintained and the staff are very friendly.  The accommodation is of a high standard and has daily maid service.  We had a top floor apartment with stunning views over the golf course. The room/apartment was huge, complete with AC, Wi-Fi and comprised of 2 large bedrooms with ample storage space.  The master bedroom was on-suite with a large shower.  There was also a large living room, separate dining room, galley style kitchen complete with full oven and 4 ring hop,…

title: We came back!!!
review: My husband and I returned to El Plantio in May.  We asked and were given the apartment we wanted and we could not have been happier.  We arrived on an early flight and asked if we could leave our baggage as our rental car was small and we would come back to check in at the proper time?  Our host Victoria immediately checked us in at midday so we could access our room.  Brilliant!!! It left us on a winner straight away.  Our apartment was of the usual standard for El Plantio, clean and welcoming.  The complex was quiet and perfect for a lazy, peaceful holiday.  Wifi in our room is a great bonus.  We stayed around the hotel a bit more this time and really enjoyed the pool area and had lunch on a couple of occasions.  The menu is small but the food is good and reasonably priced. …

title: Fabulous place
review: Myself,  husband and teenage son have just returned from a short holiday here and felt I must say how lovely it was. The apartments are lovely, stylish, roomy and very clean. The two swimming pools were gorgeous and  it was so peaceful with beautifully kept gardens and plants.We stayed there primarily for the golf  which my husband and son enjoyed a couple of times. There isn't a shop which is a bit of a shame and a little quiet on an evening but we caught the bus at the end of the road into Alicante which is very easy to do and easy to get a taxi back. The staff were very helpful. The breakfast which was included was very good although thought the food on the evening was expensive. I would definitely recommend it.

title: Lovely apartment not easy to find
review: This apartment is set on beautiful grounds near Alicante airport. Having said that we drove around for 2 hours trying to find it as it is not well sign posted and particularly hard to find in the dark. We stayed here for one night on our way up the coast so weren't there for long but could have happily stayed longer. The grounds are gorgeous with two large swimming pools. The apartment was very clean and modern. Would recommend for families and obviously for golf lovers.  We were told there was a mini bar in the room but this consisted of a couple of bottles of soft drink, two cans of beer, a chocolate bar and some olives. A bit disappointing! For such a large resort I expected there to be a shop nearby but unfortunately not, it's a drive into Alicante if you want to buy any…

title: nice and quiet
review: This holds the middle between an apartment and a hotel.  It's an apartment (2 bedrooms), but with a restaurant (which is handy for a good choice of continental breakfast) and a swimming pool available (open in the summer).  Even if you don't intend to play golf, this is a good place to stay in the Alicante area, as long as you have a car.  It's very close to the airport (but you don't hear noise from airplanes), in a little green oasis in an otherwise quite dry and barren Spanish countryside at the Costa Blanca.  When we stayed here in early May it was really quiet in this resort, which we liked a lot.  For activities, the city of Alicante is only 10 minutes drive away.

title: fantastic
review: really luxury hotel, with a bog golf course. Room or i prefer to say the apartment is so big , 3 rooms , a bif kitchen , nice terrace, and swimming pool is nice too. But just a little far from alicante center city.

title: Poor wifi
review: Stayed 2 weeks in March 2014.  Large modern apartment. 700 metres walk  the clubhouse,  500 metres to the bus 90 stop,  Cost 1.55 Euro to Alicante and the village Torrellano the other direction. 1.5 hours between buses.  The golf course in very good condition and pleasant athmosphere.  Nice place for winter golf, however I will not come back, because I want to surf with my pad or computer, but the wifi is too weak and pretty much useless most of the time.

title: Good place for cheap money
review: We was in Alicante for a week in february and stayed at this hotel. As other mentions this place offers big appartments with kitchen and washing facilities. 2 tv`s and lot of space.  We took breakfast included and was satifsfied with the list of food provided. Pancakes, egg, fresh juice and others.  As concering the training facilities it is impossible to enjoy these as they are far away from the hotel and in the golf courts where u can not walk without permit. Not good.   If you choise this hotel, you will not be angry afterwards. Rent a car and you and your families are mobile. It takes max 10 minuts in car to alicante centrum.   we will come back.

title: SUPER VALUE/SUPER ACCOMMODATION
review: Had a 2 week stay here in January and can reiterate many of the previous positive comments. We wanted to play golf and have good access to Alicante, so we booked this resort to satisfy both requirements. We had a lovely 2 bed apartment, which was very well appointed. It certainly can be classed as up market accommodation. Good quality washing machine, tumble dryer, dishwasher, microwave, oven and hob which allowed us to self cater more than adequately EXCEPT there was a limited number of pans and no toaster or sharp knives. (We were lucky enough to be able to borrow these from another source). Although we had a couple of niggles regarding maintenance, due to 24 hour maintenance, a man arrived within minutes to rectify all our problems. However, there are a couple of issues that…

title: Relaxing
review: Stayed here a few nights for business. Spacious, clean, well appointed apartment with modern kitchen, dishwasher, washing machine etc. Our room overlooked the golf course. Two swimming pools, wasn't really hot enough to swim. Very quiet and relaxing stay. Excellent location if you like golf but not near town or supermarket so you definitely need a car.

title: An oasis
review: I stayed here for work over the Christmas period, it's 15 mins from the airport and about the same into Alicante town.i was in a two bedroom apartment which was very lovely ,huge living area two bedrooms modern kitchen with oven, microwave and halogen hob, all very up market,     There was also a utility room with a washing machine and dryer .i enquired and it's £45 a night in slow season so a bargain if there's a family , it got superb views over the landscaped golf course and if you are into golf it looks a great course. You def need a car and it's in it's own area so it's a car journey everywhere , but for quiet and relaxation it's just perfect, breakfast , food and beer all reasonably priced too,

title: Really lovely for the money
review: We stayed here for 5 nights in October this year for a quick sun break before a big party (basically to top up our tans). We picked the hotel firstly because it had great prices (we paid only £45 per night for a 2 bedroomed apartment) and secondly because of its quiet location. We arrived late at night and struggled a little bit to find it - but actually it was quite well signposted when we got our bearings and well lit. We quickly got checked it and made our way to our apartment.  What we liked: 1. Massive apartment for the money - 2 bedrooms, 2 bathrooms, kitchen and living area 2, lovely balcony with sun all day 3, 2 really good swimming pools in the apartment complex which had lots of sun loungers (not of the best quality but still ok) 4. Good quality beds and great quality…

title: All you need with quality!!!
review: First time we suprise when we step in to apartment. Three bedrooms for three men. We ordered two... Apartment was clean and almost luxury, short walk to clubhouse, beautiful view from roof terrace, nice golfcourse in reasonable price, less than 15 min from airport, 15 min to downtown, long swimmingpool beside our apartment. We would choose this one again.

title: Fantastic
review: What a pity we stayed there just for 1 night. The apartment was very big (2 bedrooms, 2 bathrooms, 1 sitting room,kitchen), new, modern and fully equipped. Our balconies overlooked the golf course, a swimming pool and children area. The apartment was faultless: clean and very well maintained. Parking space was available for free. Breakfast was  generous and tasty.

title: Better than the Pictures!!!
review: My husband and I stayed in El Plantio in early September. The pictures in the brochures do not do this hotel justice. Our early flight meant our room was not ready when we arrived but despite this, we were given a warm welcome. We originally asked for a room near the pool. When we asked if we could have a room over looking the golf course, this was not a problem and boy was it well worth it.  The views were simply stunning.  Our apartment was incredibly spacious with all we could want for.  We were thrilled to say the least. We had daily cleaning and any encounter with staff was friendly, polite and professional.  The free wifi in the apartment was a real bonus despite the odd breakdown.  As the complex is out of the city, a car is essential but the peace and tranquillity is…

title: Perfect for what I was looking for but service was disappointing
review: I stayed here in September for 5 nights. I chose this because it is very close to the airport and didnt want to be travelling a great distance or hire a car.  15-20 euros to airport and around the same to the town centre. On arrival there was no help/trolleys to transport all our luggage to the apartment. No wifi in apartment (room 201) and the reception was "hit and miss" in the pool area. Very limited on utilities but wasn't a big deal as we just used what we had. The biggest negative for me was a few members of staff (mainly in the resteraunt) They didn't seem to welcome us and rushed us when ordering food/drinks.  For me, this didn't ruin our stay but I could ruin others stay!    Overall we had a really relaxing stay and would recommend this resort. However, don't expect a…

title: On the surface quite lovely, but lots of flaws...
review: The complex is simply stunning, the gardens are lush and green and with great views of one of the two pools or the golf course. The apartments are ultra modern, and comfortable, very spacious and clean. On the whole it is good value for money, and if I come again I will need to be a little better prepared.  The positives: Bright spacous apartment Washing machine, tumble drier and dishwasher Full fridge and freezer Large natural looking pools Helpful reception and maintnance (electronic safe failed on a daily basis, we gave up in the end) Beautiful gardens  The negatives No welcome pack, so there is absolutely nothing at all (salt, tea, coffee etc). You will need to buy everything you may need. No cloths for washing up, no liquid or dishwasher tablets No tea-towels Apartments…

title: Perfect for families with young children
review: We stayed here for five days Aug 13, and yes a car is a must if you want out and about, however if you want quality time with young children and don't want to spend lots of money this is the place to go. The apartments are comfortable,  spacious and very well equipped . Visit the supermarket a few miles away, fill your fridge and freezer and cook what you fancy when you fancy it, play with your children by either of the two safe pools or the small play park. The pool side and play areas are  grassed and safe. The hotel provides  floats and other toys for the kids.
