No smoking or glass is allowed at the pool and apart from ice cream and snacks there is nothing much to spend money on. There is no entertainment for older children or adults at this complex and unless you enjoy a good…

title: nice hotel, bad management
review: good: spacious apartment, 2 bathrooms, nice kitchen, washing and drying machine, dishwasher, comfortable distance to Alicante/ Elche/ Benidorm/ beaches/ supermarket; microwave oven   bad:- poor signalized on the road (the GPS data may be useful)        - no privacy for the ground apartment's terrace        - no help from the reception to get to the apt.        - not enough dishes/ mugs/ forks/ knives (family of four)        - no coffee filter (there was something like an ancient coffee maker, not electric, with old molded coffee in it)        - no corkscrew (bought it at Mercadona supermarket)        - no hairdryer (got it from the reception)        - no ironing machine (got it from the reception too)        - no changing beds (unless asked the maid; apparently every 2 days!)   …

title: Pool was murky and dangerous
review: Stayed here again as had been before and large pool was great for kids. This time the water was so unclear you could not see the bottom of the pool. This was probably dangerous for accidents in pool due to lack of visibility on water. Someone might hit their head and if on bottom of pool would not be seen. A bit of maintenance and appropriate use of chemicals such as a simple chlorine shock treatment and buffer would take care of it. Disappointing and won't be back.

title: pictures aren't everything!
review: Hi, we stayed here end June for a week, we read the reviews and thought it was a really nice place. we took note of the review about hiring a car. The place itself is really nice, the apartment would be perfect if they just placed maybe an extra 10% more effort in. A car is required as 10 minutes in the car is a large carrefour supermarket, perfect. When you arrive late at night you ask is there anywhere to buy drinks and food and you are directed to a vending machine or the mini bar in your fridge!!  As i mentioned if they placed a bit more effort in the place it would be perfect. The patio area of the apartment would be nice if they had sun loungers. The kitchen facilities are extremely limited. The swimming pool is not blue as the pictures would have you believe, and whilst…

title: The photos you see is what you get.
review: I am writing this from the sofa in one of the apartments. They are by far the nicest self catering apartments I've stayed at. Its just what we wanted but wish now we had followed advice from other reviews about hiring a car. We got a taxi into the town Torrellano for the super market and im really surprised of the lack of english that is spoken, infact in Alicante too. But its there country so its up to them. To summarize the apartments are lovely but hire a car :-)

title: Relaxing Family holiday
review: Not long back from our one week stay at the El Plantio golf resort in Alicante and I must say I was very very impressed for the cost. The apartment was clean, airy, light and a good size. All the appliances were all new and high-tech and all the windows/patio doors have the electric blind gates. The kitchen is fully equipped with everything you need and there is a fridge and freezer. IMPORTANT- DO NOT eat or drink ANY food/drink that they provide in the fridge and shelves as everyone knows mini-bars are extortionate.  The showers and en-suite were really nice. The en-suite was a wet-room style bathroom and had a nice sliding frosted door. There is also a laundry room with a washing machine and a tumble dryer- extremely handy!!  The airport is close by and the town is not too far…

title: Be careful of the sneaky mini bar trick
review: The apartrment very nice, spacious and modern,  However on check-out, we had a nasty surprise;  what had appeared to be on arrival a nice little welcome gift - a couple of beers and bottles of water in the door of the kitchen fridge, and some peanuts etc - turned out to be an extortionately priced minbar. There were no obvious indications of this in the flat, and this little and apparently intentional trick left a sour taste.   Furthermore, the equipment in the kitchen was very minimal. Other than this, a nice apartment.

title: Excellent Great Value for Money
review: We stayed at El Plantio in early June this year. The accommodation was of a very high standard. Apartments were large, clean and comfortable and serviced each day. We found the location ideal - peaceful and quiet but only a short journey into Alicante (approx 15 euros each way in a taxi). We found previous criticisms of the pool area unfounded. There were plenty of sunbeds, which looked new and the gardens around the pool areas were pretty and well maintained. Staff were friendly. We came away with the feeling we had got more than we paid for and would definitely recommend. Only downside is that there are no basic essentials in the apartments (condiments, dishwasher tablets, cloths etc) so if you are planning to self cater it could be expensive and wasteful for a short stay.

title: One night stay
review: Just one night at this resort as wanted to get to airport for an early morning flight and wish we had stayed longer. Apartment was very high spec and huge for the 2 of us. Cleaning wise, if I was being really picky was average and not quite as shiny as it could have been but the quality of fittings and fixture are faultless. the apartments would be great for a family and golf mad parents on self catering holidays for a week plus

title: Nice stay spoiled by
review: Nice stay in this hotel was spoiled by some items of clothes going missing from my wardrobe.....housekeeper and manager totally uninterested in my complaint. So if you go to this resort do not take nice clothes....apart from that its clean comfy and I would have gone back but not now.......

title: Almost ideal!
review: The resort is very close to Alicante Airport and about 6 miles from the centre of Alicante.  The apartments are quite isolated and it is worthwhile hiring a car if you wish to sight-see and move around; we hired a car from Goldcar at a rate of only £10 per day and visited nearby resorts, including Benidorm, which is about 30 miles away. Plenty of car parking is available on-site. The apartments are spacious and well equipped, ours had a lovely walk in en-suite shower in the main bedroom in addition to the main bathroom, fully equipped kitchen, including dishwasher. The swimming pools don't look immediately inviting as their colour is a sort of worn terracotta rather than the traditional blue, but they're well maintained and the water is fresh. There are enough sunbeds around the…

title: Excellent
review: Stayed for one week 31st may 7th June, Block 2 room 217. Check in quick and staff polite, Great place for a Pool Holiday which was what we wanted, Alicante city 10 mins away 11-15 euros in a taxi, Reading other reviews plenty of staff there for the amount of guest there, Loads of sunbeds, Would definitely recommend this hotel for its peaceful quiet location as I said the nite life is a taxi journey away, Food in restaurant good, Towels and beds done every day, No complaints at all would return in a heart beat :) Thank you to all in Plantio golf :))

title: Very modern and quiet.
review: After staying in Madrid, Lisbon, Sevilla and Granada, El Plantio was a very nice change of pace even though we did not take advantage of the golf course. Stayed here 2 nights. Gave us the opportunity to kick back and relax a little. The value can't be beat. We had a 2 BR suite with a Living room and kitchen and patio just off the pool. We caught up with some laundry as the unit had a washer and dryer. Buffet breakfast was delicious. Eggs and bacon!! The restaurant was a little slow for dinner but the food was good.  Nothing nearby for eating out. Some very interesting castles nearby for sightseeing.

title: Really quiet!
review: Travelled to Alicante over the bank holiday weekend with my family.It's a very quiet resort,ideal for golf enthusiast  but not offering much to anybody else.We arrived in the night and had a hard time finding our apartment,which was block 8 and a little distance from the reception,with 3 Kids,4 boxs, and 3 pieces of hand luggage,it was no easy task.With no staff around the permises(except at the reception and bar) to give us proper directions,we  had to find our way ourselves.I think  the management is keeping staff down to the bearest minimum.The Apartment was large and spacious ,as well as clean.On the second day however we ran out of hotwater and despite someone being sent to repair what ever was wrong,we continued to have lukewarm water until we checked out after our 3 night…

title: Fab...but remote!!!
review: Accommodation absolutely superb! Specification..(get me) like something out of magazine in doctors waiting room....Yes, pools are fresh?water and not cosmetic blue but crystal clear & cool for swimming.  However......we were on a 40th birthday trip and totally the wrong place for partying!! too far from Alicante...taxis cheap but not ideal!!  Would definitely stay here again for a quiet family/girls/romantic break.

title: leave the breakfast
review: Accommodation spacious but lacked warmth we stayed 2nights which was more than long enough, the breakfast was very poor, on the positive the staff where pleasant, we arrived late evening and it was hard to find our room and info on the place was none existent.

title: Almost there, but not quite...
review: My colleague and I were booked into El Planito for a last minute stay. we were staying in a 3 bedroom apartment. It seemed modern and well equipped, however some parts looking a bit tired. For instance the glass door in the en-suite was cracked around the handle and a somewhat botched repair had been made instead of replacing the door. Wi-fi, whilst free, was rather poor in strength. That was if you could connect in the first place. I suspect that there were not enough IP addresses to go around. Given that everyone has a smartphone these days, the wi-fi setup has room for improvement.  The bar and dining area came across as fairly functional and soulless. As previous reviewers have mentioned, this is primarily a golf resort. There were several large groups of golfers having a…

title: Beautiful apartments in a tranquil setting
review: We stayed here for 5 nights in April with our 15 month old daughter. After driving round for a long time we finally found the apartments. The sat nav didn't take us to the correct place so we then searched for golf courses and found it that way. The apartments are really beautiful, lovely and spacious.. Comprising of a lounge, separate kitchen, bathroom, 2 bedrooms and an en-suite, utility room and we were on the bottom floor so had a very large terrace. The apartment had all the facilities we needed for our stay, oven, microwave, utensils, washing machine, fumble dryer, dish washer. We didn't have a kettle and hair dryer, so I asked at reception and they gave us these without any problems. The staff at reception were always very helpful and pleasant throughout our stay. The…

title: very nice!
review: Even for non-golfers, this is a very pleasant spot. Excellent and large appartements for super value.Golf-course is (now?) in good condition. Pool areas are nice but some of the underwater painting is missing which is maybe what other reviews dislike.

title: Get away
review: Stayed here with my husband in September 2012. The apartments are wonderful and could easily be used as a home!! Unfortunately once you get out of the apartment, the facilities are very shabby with few sunloungers, many are broken and although the pools are spotless, they look very uninviting as they are painted in camouflage. There is little to do and there is not even a mini supermarket, which means a car is essential. My husband booked a round of golf but the course was in such terrible condition, he abandoned his round and demanded his money back. The greens were under attack from some type of fungal disease.

title: deffo value for money
review: spent two nights here with my wife apartments are very nice and spacious - esp for the price - although would not book the optional breakfast again - good location for Alicante itself and the airport - good for golfers

title: Value for money, but slightly worn down
review: I recently spent 3 nights at the El Plantio Golf Resort in the outskirts of Alicante. The hotel is conveniently located 2-3 outside of Alicante overlooking the golf course and the mountains in the horizon.  The hotel features some very nice and large apartments; nicely styled at a very competitive price. Our apartment was ~1,200 sq.ft. at €50 a day. The rooms (now) have complementary Internet. Everything looked and was very nice.  On the downside, the pool areas looked outdated and dirty. I know upkeep probably isn't a priority this time of year, but all things considered, cleaning the pool areas wouldn't do the trick. Also, some of the tile work needs to be repaired. I WILL definitely be back, and soon. :)

title: lovely
review: Booked this up for a getaway week in December, the accomodation we were given was more than expected, tghe apartment was fully furnished for a week self catering. Washing machine, tumble dryer, microwave, oven, 4 ring hob, dishwasher, kettle, iron , hairdryer. apartment had a double ensuite bedroom, and a twin bedroom with a separate bathroom. Kitchen was a galley style, sreperate dining room, utility room, 2 balconies, spacious living room with large lcd wall mounted tv ( only BBC World news) WI-FI in room, underground car parking.  10 minute drive from alicante airport, 10 minutes to alicante, 45 minutes to Benidorm.  Car is really essential as there is only the golf complex and hotel on site. Apartments back on to the 4th and 6th tee boxes and a 5 minute walk down the 5th…

title: Highly recomendable, great value!
review: We spent 1 night over this place visiting some friends in Alicante.  We rather booked a flat instead of an hotel room because of our son who is 1 year and a half and quite dynamic so we wanted something with space and comfortable. We were given a 2 bedroom flat with 2 bathrooms (1 en-suite) and we felt really well there. Flat is modern, cosy, with all the amenities you could need. It was on the base floor and the windows in the living-room were opening onto a small terrace looking at the swimming-pool through threes and big plants. Because of the location of the resort, you sleep very well as you're far from any city nuisances. We're thinking that we would definitely go back, probably with friends and we would probably make use of the golf by the way!

title: Dont stay here!
review: This hotel is rated as a 5* hotel and it certainly is not,it is more like a 3*  The rooms are clean and comfortable but the pool area, reception and bar area are very sparse and the pool is uninviting and the sun loungers are very dirty The food was not cooked well and very average It is a golf resort and unless you are going to play golf all day I would definitely not recommend this hotel

title: Wonderfull place. Shower in first bathroom had broken hoze and a burn or smudge on a settee cushiion on arrival today 26/09/12 b
review: Stunning for the price. Nice welcome. Consearned they took my credit card details since the shiwer cord is broke and there is a mark on the sofa cushion but apart from that it is trully a lovely place so far. Will add photos as the week progresses

title: Very relaxing at a very reasonable price
review: Had to book something quickly so visited Laterooms.com and got 3 bed apartment overlooking the golf course for 150 euros per night for 4 nights. Perfect for me, my wife, 3 kids and mother in law.  It is a little out of the way so car hire is a must. Location with car hire is perfect. Ideal to travel to Alicante itself or Benidorm for beaches (we did this for a day).  These are luxury apartments - no basics here. Air conditioned throughout the rooms and temp was constant. They have blackout electric shutters, balcony, fully equipped kitchen including dishwasher, dining area, living area with flatscreen TV, main bedroom has tv too.   Kettle was not in the kitchen area but a quick call to reception and one was duly sent up. Equipment in the kitchen was state of the art. Hob and…

title: Incredibly rude staff
review: My girlfriends and I came away for a relaxing girly break for 4 nights and stayed at El Plantio.   On arrival we were told that we would not recieve our room until 4pm, despite the fact that it was 10am in the morning. I have never been to a hotel where it takes this long to clean a room!!!!  We then went on a tour around the hotel to look at the surroundings. Hint: do NOT come to this hotel if sitting by the pool and relaxing is what you want. Both pools look unfinished, brown/green and were constantly murky/unclean. The surface is dangerous and both of my friends scraped themselves on the floor. To top it off, there is a maximum of 15 sunbeds to cater for the whole of the hotel, and all are reserved by 9am, leaving one to sunbathe on muddy grass as the pool area is not paved. …

title: Great hotel, need a car though
review: Great apartment, large and very modern. Washer and dryer, microwave, flat screen tv's, wet room. 2 pools both huge. Downsides being that no where was walking distance so car or taxi is a must. Bar closes at 11pm at which point the whole resort is like a ghost town.

title: Upmarket Resort
review: Extremely pleased with our 2 bed apartment.  Paid 70 euros a night for a family of 4, booking through Venere.com.  Had spent many hours searching holiday rental sights for an apartment or villa, couldn't find anything half as nice for less than double the price.  The apartments are quite spacious, modern, reasonably well maintained and very clean.  Every where else we had looked at had an end of stay cleaning fee of upwards of 100 euros, we were therfore surprised with a daily maid service washing out floors, cleaning bathrooms, emptying dust bins, making beds etc and clean towels every day, also bed linen was changed every 2-3 days. We only required to speak to reception at check in and check out and had no problems with service at any time.  Generally resort had an upmarket…

title: Very good as long as you know what to expect
review: We had done a fair bit of research about the resort before we arrived and knew what to expect. It is about 5 minutes from the airport and a car is necessary unless you want to spend a fortune on taxis. We arrived at 9pm and check in was swift and friendly. We had booked and were shown to our two bed apartment which was very well finished and spacious. There were three of us travelling and this was perfect for the apartment. There were only two chairs on the balcony and only a three seater settee in the lounge area. This was fine for us but could be a problem if there were more people in the apartment.As has been said before the kitchen equipment was not comprehensive and in fact we went out and bought large glasses as there were only wine glasses. The apartment was cleaned and…

title: Bitterly Dissapointed with the Staff  and the  rural disconnected Location
review: I had high hopes for this place after taking time to pick the "right" place for my Wife and young family. On arrival we were sent away and told to come back at 4pm as the room wasn't ready. This was annoying as the facilities outside of the pool is very very limited and we had no where to change into swimming gear and a drive of 6kms to get into Alicante were all of the local activity is based. Please beware! This place has very little to keep the kids occupied. Staff at the Bar were extremely rude to the  children and ignored my eldests request for a drink. Is her money not good enough?? The same staff member refused to take spare change to buy a drink at the bar when my Wife asked for the request. Awful!!!  The place has no entertainment and the apartments have no WiFi…

title: Apartments lovely, location very isolated
review: We stayed in a 2 bedroom apartment overlooking the golf course, the accommodation itself was clean, modern and very pleasant. The location of this hotel, despite being 10 minutes from the airport, is very isolated - it cost €34 round trip to the centre of Alicante and due to the lack of facilities at the resort, and it being self catering, it is essential to either hire or car or get taxi's. The resort has no shop - so even basic essentials need to be bought in Alicante centre. The resort does boast a shuttle service, which is slightly less costly than a taxi, however on 3 occasions it was "unavailable" during our 5 night stay. Considering the size of the resort there were few sunbeds available for use beside the 2 pools. The food and beverages available in the restaurant are…

title: Great Apartments - Poorly equipped
review: As others have said, the physical apartments are great.  We had a large 3 bedroom, 2 bathroom apartment overlooking the pool for 70 euros per night for 2.  We were OK with the location, out of Alicante is what we expected.  A bit difficult to find.  We drove past what looked like a real estate agents advertisement, following the signs to the golf course.  Wrong place.  Turn left at the big sign without arrows.  We travel well equipped, but still could not wash the dishes because there was no wash powder for the dishwasher, no dishwash detergent, no dishcloth, no T-towel and no plug for the sink!!  WiFi available only in the reception area. Would have got 5* with a little more attention to detail.  Although the finished apartments look great, there is another block of apartments…

title: Excellent accomodation
review: The apartment was absolutely wonderful, beds were comfortable. We had a balcony overlooking the golf course, very spacious, well equipped kitchen (no kettle) TV had only BBC world, eurosport in English. excellent pool with a grass surround we had no problem getting a sun bed but there were not many. Bar was quite basic but had what we needed. Wifi free in the reception area. Nothing in the immediate area, we visited the Barrio area of Alicante which was excellent and the beaches at Arenales Del Sol. Would certainly go back again.

title: Fantastic apartment but very isolated
review: The apartments are fantastic, very clean very spacious  I had a two bed ground floor backing onto the 6 hole tee. No kettle, or tea towels etc which you would expect in self catering but in general good. restaurant had set 3 meal menu, which was not very good, out of 6 nights I  enjoyed 1 meal and had to have grilled chicken on the others at a set cost of 20 euro. breakfast was ok had once, 10 Euro. The hotel is a good 20 min walk along  two roads, from the golf course and the 'shuttle bus' is not always available, this is a bit inconvenient , the club house has a slightly better menu but they close at 8pm?  then you have to walk back to the hotel. Tried to Hire golf clubs (driver and 6 iron) was told yes on Saturday at a cost of 8 Euro, but on the monday was told no have to…

title: Lovely spacious clean apartments
review: Stayed at this resort for 7 nights in a very clean well presented 2bed apartment, overlooking the golf course. Only had one issue with a noisy tv which the staff reacted very quickly to. It was not at all busy so not many staff around but as it was self catering it did not bother us. You do need a car if stopping at this resort as there are no restaurants in walking distance. It was good value for money, we would definitely go back.

title: Poor service
review: Decent location, clean apartments. Poorly stocked and staff not exactly over welcoming. Complaints not taken seriously. Tad pricey for what we got.

title: Beautiful accommodation
review: Set on one side of the golf course away from club house but views over several fairways. Just ten minutes to Alicante Airport but you would never know,it is quiet, calm and peaceful surroundings. I stayed in a two bedroom apartment with roof top terrace,it is fabulous. Very clean, the only item missing was a kettle otherwise everything else at your fingertips,if you are in the area then I cannot recommend highly enough.not ear anything so a car is essential.two swimming pools.one negative is the restaurant,every night has a set 3 course menu so no real choice. Buffet breakfast okay and the staff very helpful and even allowed a late checkout at no extra charge. Although I did not have a round of golf it was clearly a popular course and people spoke well of the set up.

title: 4 stars
review: The kitchen was wel equipt but  for self catering but things like a teapot, teaspoons and more of those little things where not available and can be a lot better

title: Great value for money,  would stay here again.
review: Great value for money,  spacious apartments.  Perfect for families or groups. As a couple we were given a very spacious 2 bed apartment with tv, kitchen etc. However we did have to move to another apartment since our heating wasn't working (a must need in feb). So, we got moved to a smaller apartment but was alot more than we needed either way. Didnt get the chance to try the food in the restaurant so cannot comment on the food. When booking ask for a room on the top floor with a pool view :)

title: Great!
review: BEAUTIFUL, spacious apartments, great value for money and good service. Wish we had stayed longer!

title: Lovely appartments but no real soul to the place
review: Not sure how to review this place, lovely appartments but totally isolated. If you want privacy then a very good spot. A car is a must there is nowhere to get any provisions so make sure to bring provisions with you as there is nothing nearby. There are no tea towells so bring or get your own. We didn't try the resteraunts but both did not beckon us in and looked void of any atmosphere and anyhow  they close after about 7.30pm. I can see the appeal for anyone on a golf holiday but ultimately the complex appeared to be not one thing or another and lacked a focal point or any atmosphere. I was not left with the feeling that I would return which was a shame really.

title: Great but could be better
review: Stayed in mid September. Would highly recommend. It's a bit out in the sticks but only 3 miles from either the airport or Alicantie itself. A strange set-up for a Four star hotel its more like a time share complex. We joked that it was a bit like a cross between the set of The Prisoner and the set of Elderado. The accommodation is excellent. We had a two bedroom apartment which seems to be the smallest available.  You get a master with large en-suite and flat screen TV. Another decent sized bedroom. A bath room with shower. Large living dining / kitchen area leading on to a large balcony, ours was on the ground floor and in a corner so was especially generous. You even get a utility room with washer and dryer. There is Air con throughout. Although the accommodation was excellent…

title: Amazing apartments
review: I have just got back from a week holiday with my husband and 14 month old daughter, we had a great stay. Rooms were kept clean and towels were changed daily. Bed was sooo comfy and it was nice having air con in the room when the temperature outside was 30+C in September.  We went self catering thinking we could go to the supermarket when we arrived to discover it was closed due to it being a sunday.  The apartment itself was gorgeous and would stay there again - I would recommend you take washing up liquid, sponge, clothes, dishwasher tablets and washing powder - I took all with me after reading reviews (despite my husband telling me not to bother).  The kitchen is well equiped with a utility room - washing machine, dryer, dishwasher, fridge, cooker, microwave and kettle. The…

title: Very Very Nice but
review: These apartments are lovely and clearly were built to sell as luxury apartments until the big bust and now they are rented out as an hotel. The setting is nice and quiet (if you like that) and the pool being heated is great for all ages. I agree with the reviews that there arent many sunbeds but there seemed enough when I stayed in July. The restuarant is not very good its ok for a sandwhich and some chips but thats about it. We took our 2 year old boy and he loved it and it was nice it was out of the way a bit. The golf course is ok, the usual when playing abroad a bit overpriced but the views from the holes at the top are spectacular.

title: Very relaxing, a home from home!
review: My family and I have just returned from a very relaxing holiday in the Oasis Plantio appts.  On arrival we were allocated a 3 bedroom appt when only booked a 2 bed which was a lovely suprise our room had an en-suite bathroom with shower and my children had their own bathroom with shower and bath which was a luxury to have such space.  The appartments were very impressive and spacious with fully fitted kitched with full size fridge freezer which we filled after visiting the local super market approx 10 mins away the " Mercadona", microwave, hob and full size oven and dishwasher, only prob is they dont leave any dishwasher tabs or washing up liquid to start you off so you have to buy this in also there is a utility room with washing machine and dryer which was handy as went home…

title: Absolutely brilliant holiday
review: Loved this place, was so relaxing.  Apartments were first class and very comfortable.  We had stunning views of the golf course and pool.  The staff were very friendly and helpful.  My only complaint is the selfishness of other English holidaymakers (no not germans but English people).  As in previous reviews I can confirm the lack of sunbeds and where I did not find it a hardship to spread my towel and the grass for a spot of sunbathing it would have been nice to lie on a sunbed occassionaly.  I was disgusted by people getting up early to go to the pool to reserve sunbeds (one woman passed my apartment every day at roughly 8.45 to reserve 4 sunbeds) by placing their towels on them and then leaving them there for the rest of the morning, sometimes up to 4 hours.  Now this…

title: OK if you do not like to be by the pool!!
review: This resort and location was excellent for us but there was one huge drawback which ruined our holiday and eventually forced us to move to a different resort.  We booked this as a pool holiday as that is what we all like. Not into beaches and sea etc! There are just under 100 apartments with about 300 guests here and 2 swimming pools but only 31 sun beds in total and hardly any parasols!!   There was virtually no chance of getting one, let alone 3 for my wife, daughter and I. This meant you were on the hard standing or grass next to the pool with no shade at all in the 33 degree heat of August. For us this is our whole holiday and we were not able to complete it. We moved to a villa with pool further up the coast.  I spoke to staff on site who, rather embarrassedly said, that…

title: mixed opinions on this hotel
review: hotel was lovely,apartments are lovely,staff are mixed as some are lovely and some are good at communicating especially on reception, others are not and are a little rude as well.mainly in the eating area a bit rude.Food is not very good,poor choice often alot of chips,alot of cold food as stood along while in the heat trays.Dinner left for 4 hours in trayus and no water to drink,no butter,bread very hard,fruity was all overripe. Breakfast is lovely best meal they do although eggs were all dried up,juice very watered down,no butter.Accomadation is fabulous,too far from town and shops,no food shop on site either for bread and drinks etc. Cost 30 euros to do return to town so expensive and unable to get bus or walk as on the motorway as well as a long way to go,20 mins away. No…

title: very relaxing, peaceful holiday
review: We read reviews before booking so had a good idea of what to expect.  On arrival at the airport we phoned the hotel and they sent the minibus to come and collect us it cost us 10 euro and is about a 5 minute journey.  We arrived at 10:30am and were able to check in straight away.  We had a 2 bed apartment which was very large and the master bedroom had an en-suite.  We were on the ground floor and had a large terrace area overlooking one of the swimming pools.      We had our own washing machine, tumble dryer, built in microwave, over, dishwasher, kitchen, dining area, living room, 2 bedrooms, 2 bathrooms and lots of storage space and wardrobe space.  There are 2 large swimming pools at the hotel,  both have a shallow child friendly area so ideal for younger children and both…

title: Very nice stay for a family meeting near Alicante
review: We were in the Be Live Plantio Golf for 3 nights in April 2011. We rent a big 3 bedrooms apartment for all of us ... a couple + 3 kids, my husband's parents and my mother. It was very easy to arrive to the Hotel both from airport and from Alicante City (we had GPS anyway... :-) ) The apartment was very nice, modern furnished , clean and well equiped. There is a great supermarket just some minutes (by car) from there - Carrefour (in a small mall).  Personel were very kind and professional (we speak Spanish...). I would surelly stay there again...

title: Amazing Apartments but...
review: These were probably the nicest apartments that I have ever stayed in but, I would say that the restaurant is not great and over priced.  The consequence of this, as other reviewers have said, is that you have to go into Alicante to eat which is very expensive altogether.  The taxi rides plus meals set us back a great deal of money for only a short stay.  Hire a car and shop at the nearby Carrefour supermarket and you will have a fab stay!

title: Great apartments but a couple of small issues
review: First, the pros: the apartments at this place are extremely-well kitted out, and also pretty spacious. We booked directly with the hotel for two nights, and although there were only two of us, they put us into a two-bedroom apartment (not sure if the one-bed ones were all taken), at 100 euro a night including breakfast. Now, I'd not have complained too much if our accommodation ended at the bedroom door (which included an en-suite shower room), but we also got another bedroom, a bathroom, a utility room, a kitchen, a dining room, a living room, a large terrace with cane furniture, and because we were on the top floor, a staircase up to our own roof terrace! The staff were very friendly, especially Toni at the restaurant. Also, the grounds were absolutely stunning, and the two…

title: Only one regret...
review: We landed in Alicante at 10.30 in the morning, having had an early flight and minimal sleep the night before. We got to this hotel an hour later and didn't have much hope that it would be okay to check in so early. However, we were immediately impressed by the beautiful surroundings of the hotel and we would have been quite content to sit in the bar and wait until we could check in. Fortunately, the early check in wasn't a problem at all and we were given the key to our 'room' (no 304) straight away.   When we walked into our accommodation we couldn't believe our luck. The room is an apartment with two enormous bedrooms (one ensuite), a living room, kitchen, utility and bathroom. The kitchen was fully equipped and boasted siemens equipment throughout. On opening the shutter, we…

title: Pretty damned Good
review: Stayed here for a 4 night break in June.   Here are the good points. 2 pools are beautiful and very clean and well designed.  The apartments are spacious and finished to a really good quality, the apartments are kitted out with full kitchen, also in the utility there is a washing machine and a tumble dryer, this was great as we did all of our laundry and travelled home with clean clothes!  The gardens in the complex are stunning. The staff were very polite and always had a nice smile.   Whilst we really enjoyed the hotel here are some of the goings that they should really improve on....... The restaurant were only able to serve around half of the items on the menu, even though the hotel was at full capacity. The golf clubhouse was a 20 minute walk from the hotel and we were…

title: Quiet with a great apartments
review: The location is about 10 minutes by taxi from Alicante (a much bigger and more vibrant city than I'd thought!). Its a golfing resort but I can't comment on that as neither me or my wife play. We just went for a relax by the pool and do nothing holiday and for that it works well. We only tried the food at the poolside restaurant which was ok but limited.  The breakfasts were very nice though. The best way to enjoy the hotel is to go full self catering, the apartments are lovely. Very modern, great layout, roomy with well equipped kitchen - which I wish we had taken more advantage of. No sign of the coffee maker advertised though.... Pool is lovely. Great place for peace and quiet in beautiful surrounds. Staff were all very helpful too. Recommended

title: Information provided could be improved upon
review: We stayed at this apartment resort for 10 days.  The apartment was great, as were most of the staff.  However, people need to know that they have to call the hotel to arrange for the shuttle to pick them up at the airport, and have to go to Level Two of the airport, outside the Arrivals Hall, to be picked up.  The hotel shuttle has El Plantio written on the side (the hotel staff only told us to "go upstairs" and when asked, did not say that the name of the hotel was on the shuttle, even when specifically asked).  The nice thing about the shuttle is that no matter how many people in your party, it only costs 10 euros per trip.  The apartment kitchens are fully equipped and if there is something you need, just call the receptionist and ask for it.  However, the coffee makers and…

title: Lovely weekend break
review: We stayed here last minute and loved the spacious, very comfy, well laid out apartments. We love nice hotels and have stayed all over the world in someof the best, ncluding barcelo asia gardens in nearby benidorm. Plantio golf apartments are fantastic.  The location is beautiful, and is a 5/10 min drive to the lovely city of alicante.  Value for money, this place in unbeatable.  We only paid 70 euros for 2 adults and 2 kids in a 2 bed place.  We did the driving range -only 5 euros.  the resort is quiet but that suits a lot of people and with alicante being so close we didnt find it an issue at all. But best if you have a car if you are there more than a few days.  I was a bit cold in the night, and could have done with more covers, but I always am cold. Lovely little park for…

title: beautiful but too quiet
review: gorgeous setting apartments are gogeous pics dont do justice.sense of security is great as appartments have steel shutters by switch control. two pools and small play  park. breakfasts are great but evening is quite bland and repeatative. we stayed with two kids in mid july yet entertainment didn't start till august so extremely quiet. we met a nice couple with one child so helped. but we were usually the only people at pool thru day and around after 8pm. would be great for larger crowd. you need a car to go anywhere outside complex ie for any entertainment or cuisine choice.

title: Discretion and comfort
review: The building choice of separate block of rooms/small apartments is the best for a group of five girls on holiday. The apartment was silent and very well refined, the rooms and the bathrooms large and clean. I appreciated especially the spruce garden and the not-commonly-blue-tessellated swimming pool! Beakfast little disappointed me (I expected more in terms of variety and selection of food), even if it could be considered a traditionally continental one.  Useful (since the hotel is outside the city) and quite cheap (about 10 € a trip) the shuttle service to and from everywhere you want.

title: The best hotel I've ever stayed in.
review: Beautiful location, you step out and it feels like Australia! Palm trees, exotic, amazing surroundings. Everything's so bright - lovely warm welcome in the mornings. The reception/receptionists are very friendly & helpful! I couldn't fail to fall in love with the stunning posh apartments they gave us, we could really make ourselves at home. The food is lovely. You'd never get bored here! Great taxi service to get into the town centre which is also so much fun with lovely restaurants beaches and things to see, as this hotel is a bit out of the way! However this is a good thing because it's so peaceful. My family and I loved it. Gracias for making it the best holiday ever, estupendo! Naturalmente Me vuelvo en el verano. Me encanta España! XX
